Reset the password of Bjoern's OWASP acc: Reset the password of Bjoern's OWASP account via the Forgot Password mechanism with the original answer to his security question.
He might have trumpeted it on at least o: He might have trumpeted it on at least one occasion where a camera was running. Maybe elsewhere as well.
Learn about the Token Sale before its of: Learn about the Token Sale before its official announcement.
The developers truly believe in \"Securi: The developers truly believe in "Security through Obscurity" over actual access restrictions.
Take over the wallet containing our offi: Take over the wallet containing our official Soul Bound Token (NFT).
Find the seed phrase posted accidentally: Find the seed phrase posted accidentally.
Mint the Honey Pot NFT by gathering BEEs: Mint the Honey Pot NFT by gathering BEEs from the bee haven.
Discover NFT wonders among the captivati: Discover NFT wonders among the captivating visual memories.
Withdraw more ETH from the new wallet th: Withdraw more ETH from the new wallet than you deposited.
Try to exploit the contract of the walle: Try to exploit the contract of the wallet.
Find an accidentally deployed code sandb: Find an accidentally deployed code sandbox for writing smart contracts on the fly.
It is just as easy as finding the Score: It is just as easy as finding the Score Board.
Perform a Remote Code Execution that wou: Perform a Remote Code Execution that would keep a less hardened application busy forever.
The feature you need to exploit for this: The feature you need to exploit for this challenge is not directly advertised anywhere.
Submit 10 or more customer feedbacks wit: Submit 10 or more customer feedbacks within 20 seconds.
Bypass the Content Security Policy and p: Bypass the Content Security Policy and perform an XSS attack with <script>alert(`xss`)</script> on a legacy page within the application.
What is even \"better\" than a legacy pa: What is even "better" than a legacy page with a homegrown RegEx sanitizer? Having CSP injection issues on the exact same page as well!
Perform a <i>persisted</i> XSS attack wi: Perform a persisted XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)"> bypassing a client-side security mechanism.
Only some input fields validate their in: Only some input fields validate their input. Even less of these are persisted in a way where their content is shown on another screen.
Analyze and tamper with links in the app: Analyze and tamper with links in the application that deliver a file directly.
Look for an input field where its conten: Look for an input field where its content appears in the HTML when its form is submitted.
Exfiltrate the entire DB schema definiti: Exfiltrate the entire DB schema definition via SQL Injection.
Find out where this information could co: Find out where this information could come from. Then craft a UNION SELECT attack string against an endpoint that offers an unnecessary way to filter data.
Use a deprecated B2B interface that was: Use a deprecated B2B interface that was not properly shut down.
The developers who disabled the interfac: The developers who disabled the interface think they could go invisible by just closing their eyes.
If you solved one of the three file acce: If you solved one of the three file access challenges, you already know where to find the easter egg.
Perform an unwanted information disclosu: Perform an unwanted information disclosure by accessing data cross-domain.
Try to find and attack an endpoint that: Try to find and attack an endpoint that responds with user information. SQL Injection is not the solution here.
Register a user with an empty email and: Register a user with an empty email and password.
Consider intercepting and playing with t: Consider intercepting and playing with the request payload.
Log in with the (non-existing) accountan: Log in with the (non-existing) accountant acc0unt4nt@juice-sh.op without ever registering that user.
Try to create the needed user \"out of t: Try to create the needed user "out of thin air".
Try to submit bad input to forms. Altern: Try to submit bad input to forms. Alternatively tamper with URL paths or parameters.
Successfully redeem an expired campaign: Successfully redeem an expired campaign coupon code.
Try to identify past special event or ho: Try to identify past special event or holiday campaigns of the shop first.
Retrieve the language file that never ma: Retrieve the language file that never made it into production.
Brute force is not the only option for t: Brute force is not the only option for this challenge, but a perfectly viable one.
Get rid of all 5-star customer feedback.
Once you found admin section of the appl: Once you found admin section of the application, this challenge is almost trivial.
Forge a coupon code that gives you a dis: Forge a coupon code that gives you a discount of at least 80%.
Try either a) a knowledgeable brute forc: Try either a) a knowledgeable brute force attack or b) reverse engineering or c) some research in the cloud.
Post some feedback in another user's nam: Post some feedback in another user's name.
You can solve this by tampering with the: You can solve this by tampering with the user interface or by intercepting the communication with the RESTful backend.
Post a product review as another user or: Post a product review as another user or edit any user's existing review.
Observe the flow of product review posti: Observe the flow of product review posting and editing and see if you can exploit it.
Forge an almost properly RSA-signed JWT: Forge an almost properly RSA-signed JWT token that impersonates the (non-existing) user rsa_lord@juice-sh.op.
This challenge is explicitly not about a: This challenge is explicitly not about acquiring the RSA private key used for JWT signing.
Access a developer's forgotten backup fi: Access a developer's forgotten backup file.
You need to trick a security mechanism i: You need to trick a security mechanism into thinking that the file you want has a valid file type.
Access a salesman's forgotten backup fil: Access a salesman's forgotten backup file.
<a href=\"/#/contact\">Inform the shop</: Inform the shop about a typosquatting imposter that dug itself deep into the frontend. (Mention the exact name of the culprit)
This challenge has nothing to do with mi: This challenge has nothing to do with mistyping web domains. There is no conveniently misplaced file helping you with this one either. Or is there?
Log in with Chris' erased user account.
Turns out that something is technically: Turns out that something is technically and legally wrong with the implementation of the "right to be forgotten" for users.
Steal someone else's personal data witho: Steal someone else's personal data without using Injection.
Trick the regular Data Export to give yo: Trick the regular Data Export to give you more than actually belongs to you.
Perform a <i>persisted</i> XSS attack wi: Perform a persisted XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)"> through an HTTP header.
Finding a piece of displayed information: Finding a piece of displayed information that could originate from an HTTP header is part of this challenge.
Solve challenge #999. Unfortunately, thi: Solve challenge #999. Unfortunately, this challenge does not exist.
You need to trick the hacking progress p: You need to trick the hacking progress persistence feature into thinking you solved challenge #999.
Dumpster dive the Internet for a leaked: Dumpster dive the Internet for a leaked password and log in to the original user account it belongs to. (Creating a new account with the same password does not qualify as a solution.)
Once you have it, a technique called \"P: Once you have it, a technique called "Password Spraying" might prove useful.
Identify an unsafe product that was remo: Identify an unsafe product that was removed from the shop and inform the shop which ingredients are dangerous.
Your own SQLi and someone else's Ctrl-V: Your own SQLi and someone else's Ctrl-V will be your accomplices in this challenge!
<a href=\"/#/contact\">Inform the shop</: Inform the shop about a typosquatting trick it has been a victim of at least in v6.2.0-SNAPSHOT. (Mention the exact name of the culprit)
This challenge has nothing to do with mi: This challenge has nothing to do with mistyping web domains. Investigate the forgotten developer's backup file instead.
Log in with the administrator's user acc: Log in with the administrator's user account.
Try different SQL Injection attack patte: Try different SQL Injection attack patterns depending whether you know the admin's email address or not.
Log in with Amy's original user credenti: Log in with Amy's original user credentials. (This could take 93.83 billion trillion trillion centuries to brute force, but luckily she did not read the "One Important Final Note")
This challenge will make you go after a: This challenge will make you go after a needle in a haystack.
Log in with Bender's user account.
If you know Bender's email address, try: If you know Bender's email address, try SQL Injection. Bender's password hash might not help you very much.
Log in with Bjoern's Gmail account <i>wi: Log in with Bjoern's Gmail account without previously changing his password, applying SQL Injection, or hacking his Google account.
The security flaw behind this challenge: The security flaw behind this challenge is 100% OWASP Juice Shop's fault and 0% Google's.
Log in with Jim's user account.
Try cracking Jim's password hash if you: Try cracking Jim's password hash if you harvested it already. Alternatively, if you know Jim's email address, try SQL Injection.
Log in with MC SafeSearch's original use: Log in with MC SafeSearch's original user credentials without applying SQL Injection or any other bypass.
You should listen to MC's hit song \"Pro: You should listen to MC's hit song "Protect Ya Passwordz".
Log in with the support team's original: Log in with the support team's original user credentials without applying SQL Injection or any other bypass.
The underlying flaw of this challenge is: The underlying flaw of this challenge is a lot more human error than technical weakness.
Put an additional product into another u: Put an additional product into another user's shopping basket.
Have an eye on the HTTP traffic while pl: Have an eye on the HTTP traffic while placing products in the shopping basket. Changing the quantity of products already in the basket doesn't count.
Like any review at least three times as: Like any review at least three times as the same user.
Punctuality is the politeness of kings.
Apply some advanced cryptanalysis to fin: Apply some advanced cryptanalysis to find the real easter egg.
You might have to peel through several l: You might have to peel through several layers of tough-as-nails encryption for this challenge.
Let the server sleep for some time. (It: Let the server sleep for some time. (It has done more than enough hard work for you)
This challenge is essentially a stripped: This challenge is essentially a stripped-down Denial of Service (DoS) attack.
All your orders are belong to us! Even t: All your orders are belong to us! Even the ones which don't.
Take a close look on how the $where quer: Take a close look on how the $where query operator works in MongoDB.
Update multiple product reviews at the s: Update multiple product reviews at the same time.
Take a close look on how the equivalent: Take a close look on how the equivalent of UPDATE-statements in MongoDB work.
We might have failed to take this out of: We might have failed to take this out of our code properly.
Log in with the administrator's user cre: Log in with the administrator's user credentials without previously changing them or applying SQL Injection.
This one should be equally easy to a) br: This one should be equally easy to a) brute force, b) crack the password hash or c) simply guess.
Place an order that makes you rich.
You literally need to make the shop owe: You literally need to make the shop owe you any amount of money.

You do not have to pay anything to unloc: You do not have to pay anything to unlock this challenge! Nonetheless, donations are very much appreciated.

Look for a url parameter where its value: Look for a url parameter where its value appears in the page it is leading to.
You can solve this by cleverly interacti: You can solve this by cleverly interacting with the UI or bypassing it altogether.
Reset Bender's password via the <a href=: Reset Bender's password via the Forgot Password mechanism with the original answer to his security question.
Not as trivial as Jim's but still not to: Not as trivial as Jim's but still not too difficult with some "Futurama" background knowledge.
Reset the password of Bjoern's internal: Reset the password of Bjoern's internal account via the Forgot Password mechanism with the original answer to his security question.
Nothing a little bit of Facebook stalkin: Nothing a little bit of Facebook stalking couldn't reveal. Might involve a historical twist.
Reset Jim's password via the <a href=\"/: Reset Jim's password via the Forgot Password mechanism with the original answer to his security question.
It's hard for celebrities to pick a secu: It's hard for celebrities to pick a security question from a hard-coded list where the answer is not publicly exposed.
Reset Morty's password via the <a href=\: Reset Morty's password via the Forgot Password mechanism with his obfuscated answer to his security question.
Find a way to bypass the rate limiting a: Find a way to bypass the rate limiting and brute force the obfuscated answer to Morty's security question.
Deprive the shop of earnings by download: Deprive the shop of earnings by downloading the blueprint for one of its products.
The product you might want to give a clo: The product you might want to give a closer look is the OWASP Juice Shop Logo (3D-printed).
Request a hidden resource on server thro: Request a hidden resource on server through server.
Reverse engineering something bad can ma: Reverse engineering something bad can make good things happen.
Infect the server with juicy malware by: Infect the server with juicy malware by abusing arbitrary command execution.
\"SSTi\" is a clear indicator that this: "SSTi" is a clear indicator that this has nothing to do with anything Angular. Also, make sure to use only our non-malicious malware.
Try to find a reference or clue behind t: Try to find a reference or clue behind the scenes. Or simply guess what URL the Score Board might have.
Behave like any \"white-hat\" should bef: Behave like any "white-hat" should before getting into the action.
Undoubtedly you want to read our securit: Undoubtedly you want to read our security policy before conducting any research on our application.
Perform a <i>persisted</i> XSS attack wi: Perform a persisted XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)"> bypassing a server-side security mechanism.

No matter how good your eyes are, you wi: No matter how good your eyes are, you will need tool assistance for this challenge.
Perform a Remote Code Execution that occ: Perform a Remote Code Execution that occupies the server for a while without using infinite loops.
Your attack payload must not trigger the: Your attack payload must not trigger the protection against too many iterations.

This vulnerability will not affect any c: This vulnerability will not affect any customer of the shop. It is aimed exclusively at its developers.
Solve the 2FA challenge for user \"wurst: Solve the 2FA challenge for user "wurstbrot". (Disabling, bypassing or overwriting his 2FA settings does not count as a solution)
The 2FA implementation requires to store: The 2FA implementation requires to store a secret for every user. You will need to find a way to access this secret in order to solve this challenge.
Forge an essentially unsigned JWT token: Forge an essentially unsigned JWT token that impersonates the (non-existing) user jwtn3d@juice-sh.op.

Upload a file larger than 100 kB.

Upload a file that has no .pdf or .zip e: Upload a file that has no .pdf or .zip extension.

Retrieve a list of all user credentials: Retrieve a list of all user credentials via SQL Injection.
Gather information on where user data is: Gather information on where user data is stored and how it is addressed. Then craft a corresponding UNION SELECT attack.
Embed an XSS payload <code>&lt;/script&g: Embed an XSS payload </script><script>alert(`xss`)</script> into our promo video.
You have to reuse the vulnerability behi: You have to reuse the vulnerability behind one other 6-star challenge to be able to solve this one.

<a href=\"/#/contact\">Inform the shop</: Inform the shop about an algorithm or library it should definitely not use the way it does.

You have to find a way to beat the allow: You have to find a way to beat the allowlist of allowed redirect URLs.

Check the Photo Wall for an image that c: Check the Photo Wall for an image that could not be loaded correctly.

This challenge would formally have to be: This challenge would formally have to be in several categories as the developers made multiple gaffes for this to be possible.

Obtain a Deluxe Membership without payin: Obtain a Deluxe Membership without paying for it.
Look closely at what happens when you at: Look closely at what happens when you attempt to upgrade your account.
Change the name of a user by performing: Change the name of a user by performing Cross-Site Request Forgery from another origin.

When answered truthfully, all security q: When answered truthfully, all security questions are susceptible to online research (on Facebook, LinkedIn etc.) and often even brute force. If at all, they should not be used as the only factor for a security-relevant function.

DEF CON will always be a cash-at-the-doo: DEF CON will always be a cash-at-the-door conference. We will always honor the LineCon. This is the way.
